why_shark_bay_for_demo: World's largest seagrass carbon stock - compelling blue carbon narrative
Demonstrated climate vulnerability (2011 heatwave) provides risk case study
Carbon-dominant ESV profile contrasts with Cabo Pulmo's tourism-dominant profile
UNESCO World Heritage status provides governance credibility
Active blue carbon research program with peer-reviewed data (Arias-Ortiz 2018)
demo_value.investor_story: Shark Bay holds the world's largest seagrass carbon stock, storing up to 1.3% of all seagrass sediment carbon globally. At $21.5M/year in ecosystem services - dominated by $12.1M in carbon sequestration value - it represents a premier blue carbon investment opportunity. However, the 2011 marine heatwave, which destroyed 36% of seagrass and released 2-9 Tg CO2, demonstrates the permanence risk that investors must price into carbon credit instruments. MARIS rates Shark Bay AA - strong fundamentals with material climate risk.
